original: GELHAAR, Stefan Julius, Ingenjör, Ljungaverk, f O van s j ö, Gävleb l, 26/12 76 av skom o fältmusikanten E G o Anna Holmström, gm (2) Inez Rur. Arb v Hofors hästskofabr Ås-hammar 91, målarlärl o arb Hedesunda o Gävle 92—98, lab.bitr Sthlms Superfosf.fabr AB :s kloratfabr Månsbo 98, l :e ass v fabr.lab där 04, v exp.lab 07, förest detta 14, lab.förest o bibi v bol:s fil Ljungaverk sed. 28. Kom-munalflm Grytnäs 19—25 mm. Led Sv Tekn.frn samt Sv Uppfinnarefrn. Av trycket: Med-arb i Ullmans Encyklopedie der techn Chemie, upps i Tekn Tidskr. ProPstGM.
translated:
GELHAAR, Stefan Julius, Engineer, Ljungaverk, born on the island of Van in the Gävleborg County, December 26, 1876, son of the shoemaker and field musician E G and Anna Holmström, married (2) Inez Rur. Worked at the Hofors horse shoe factory Åshammar from 1891, apprentice painter and worked in Hedesunda and Gävle from 1892 to 1898, laboratory assistant at Stockholm Superphosphate Factory AB's chlorate factory in Månsbo in 1898, promoted to first assistant in 1904, promoted to chief of experimentation in 1907, former head of department in 1914, laboratory supervisor and librarian at the company's headquarters in Ljungaverk since 1928. Municipal official in Grytnäs from 1919 to 1925, among other positions. Member of the Swedish Society of Technicians and the Swedish Inventors' Association. Contributed to Ullmans Encyclopedia of Chemical Technology, published in Technical Journal. ProPstGM.

Note: The abbreviation "ProPstGM" is not clear and cannot be translated without further context.
